I like R better than Python.
Many of you have asked how I could possibly prefer R to Python despite using both in my work.
Data science is not the same in every organization (and this is a good thing).
Remember that “Data Science” does not always necessarily include “Deep Learning.”

On my team we use data science to do science. We facilitate medical and pharmaceutical discoveries. Our clients are scientists. Attention to detail, reproducibility, documentation of methods (and decisions regarding analysis), and presentation and interpretation of results are paramount.

I believe that R simply does these things better, particularly data visualization. In my mind there is no good alternative to R Notebooks / R Markdown in Python (I love Juptyer notebooks btw but they really don’t compare).
When we want to access an API, put one of our algorithms in production, or develop a new method into an app we turn to Python.
But we use R for science.
Can AI help businesses make better decisions?

I’m a Technical Recruiter with Randstad Technologies, specifically I support some of our largest clients in major Mid-West cities like St. Louis, Indianapolis, and Columbus. I’m always excited to make new connections and grow my network! If you’re looking for work or if you’re looking for candidates I’m happy to be a point of contact. Even if your eyes are set outside of the Mid-West, I’m happy to help or point you in a great direction. I’m always looking for new connections with Developers, Business Analysts, Quality Analysts, and Project Managers. We also staff data centers, we hire Helpdesk, and Desktop support professionals. Even if you don’t consider yourself “Technical” I’m happy to connect, many of our clients also look for functional and business facing candidates!At Randstad, we support our clients’ needs on Contracting, Contract to Hire, and a Direct Hire basis. Also, we can offer VISA Sponsorship, and Green Card processing.Send me an invite if you’re just looking for a new connection or have something specific in mind!

Psi Chi, Psychology Student Association, Student Outreach Association

I earned a double major in psychology and communication. I worked my way onto the President's list, and graduated with a GPA of 3.48. I was nominated to the position of President of our PSI CHI chapter, and to the Publicist of our Psychology Student Association. I later became a member of the Student Outreach Association, a student run organization focused on volunteering for the local community.

summary: I graduated from Southern New Hampshire University in May of 2012 with a double major in psychology and communication. I've held professional positions in both the psychology and communication fields, and continue working to meld the two together. I have an unmeasurable passion for using the communication skills I sharpened during my education to help others. This burning passion is what always pushes me to look for more and set my expectations higher.
